titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James Ware Pitts Photographs, 1984-1998 RL.11433
titlestmt.author: Paula Jeannet Mangiafico

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-04-11 10:13:16 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection comprises five 4x5 inch matted black-and-white palladium contact prints, featuring abandoned or run-down manmade structures in the natural landscape. Locations include the Southwest (Texas, New Mexico, and Arizona) and the Olympic Pensinsula. Acquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: James Ware Pitts, a photographer born in Huntsville, Alabama and based in Santa Fe, New Mexico, specializes in platinum and palladium print making. His work ranges from anthropological documentary studies to formal pictorial traditionalism.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Photographs are available for non-commercial exhibition, research, and educational purposes only. The photographer must give permission for any other type of use.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The James Ware Pitts photographs were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2002.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], James Ware Pitts photographs, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises five 4x5 inch matted black-and-white palladium contact prints, featuring abandoned or run-down manmade structures in the natural landscape. Locations include the Southwest (Texas, New Mexico, and Arizona) and the Olympic Pensinsula. Acquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession(s) represented in this collection guide: 2002-0277.

Dinosaur with sleigh, near Santa Fe, New Mexico
